page.title: 16POPULATION OF ST. TEATH
page.content: THERE HAS BEEN LITTLE MOVEMENT OF POPULATION INTO, OR OUT OF ST. TEATH UNTIL VERY RECENT TIMES. BEFORE 197O, WHEN THE FIRST HOUSING ESTATE WAS BUILT,THE VAST MAJORITY OF THE INHABITANTS HAD BEEN CORNISH, BEING BORN AND BROUGHT UP IN THE VILLAGE. DURING THE PAST FIFTEEN YEARS THERE HAS BEEN AN INFLUX OF PEOPLE MAINLY FROM THE HOME COUNTIES. MANY ARE RETIRED COUPLES FOR WHOM LOW-PRICED BUNGALOWS ARE THE ATTRACTION. A GROWING NUMBER OF VILLAGERS ARE CONCERNED ABOUT RECENT AND FORTHCOMING DEVELOPMENT. TWO NEW ESTATES COMPRISING OF ABOUT A HUNDRED DWELLINGS AND MODERN BUNGALOWS GIVE RISE TO FEARS THAT THE VILLAGE IS GROWING TOO FAST AND WILL THEREBY LOSE ITS IDENTITY.
